Type.Name: Button

TypeSignature.Value: public class Button : Gtk.Bin, Implementor, IWrapper, IWrapper, IDisposable

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: A widget that creates a signal when clicked on.

remarks.para: The GtkButton widget is generally used to attach a function to that is called when the button is pressed. The various signals and how to use them are outlined below.
The GtkButton widget can hold any valid child widget. That is it can hold most any other standard . The most commonly used child is the .

Docs.returns: To be added: an object of type 'Gtk.ColorSelectionDialog'

Docs.param: To be added: an object of type 'Gtk.ColorSelectionDialog'
To be added: an object of type 'IntPtr'
Docs.returns: To be added: an object of type 'Gtk.ColorSelectionDialog+Button'
